definition: large number of people
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
to congregate in one hall (idiom); to gather under one roof

sentences.english: Teacher, I wish you the education students, a galaxy of talents, the elite men.
sentences.chinese: 老师，祝您教育的学生，人才济济，精英辈出。

sentences.english: The Performance Team is a highly energetic one and is full of very talented people.
sentences.chinese: 性能团队的精力是非常充沛的，并且人才济济。

sentences.english: Linguists from all over the country assembled at the symposium.
sentences.chinese: 研讨会上全国的语言学家济济一堂。

sentences.english: Participants from different parts of the world have come to compete and win the prestigious title of the Big Fish Hunter.
sentences.chinese: 来自各地的参赛者济济一堂，都来争夺钓鱼王的称号。

sentences.english: The chaplain came and preaches to a packed church.
sentences.chinese: 牧师来了，向济济一堂的教友们布了道。

sentences.english: The star-studded film is actually very disappointing.
sentences.chinese: 这部明星济济的电影其实很令人失望。

sentences.english: The guests gathered in the banquet hall, the Great Hall of the People, which was filled with warm and festive atmosphere. The national emblem was placed above the podium.
sentences.chinese: 人民大会堂宴会厅内宾朋济济一堂，气氛喜庆热烈。

definition: a genius/a talented person
to come forth in large numbers
lit. firebird and phoenix come together (idiom)/fig. a gathering of eminent people
variant of 人才[ren2 cai2]
(literary) to mushroom/to flourish
outstanding talent/wise and able person/illustrious individual
virtuous person/a man of merit
sage
having both integrity and talent (idiom)
learned/erudite/scholarly
experienced scholar/old expert in the field
assemblage of talented individuals/ensemble of heroes
a contemporary/similar class of people
prominent and worthy personage
hero/towering figure
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
